intro: Aeschynomene batekensis, commonly known as Batekensis morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Aeschynomene batekensis is often found in disturbed habitats, including roadsides and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun. Its rapid growth and ability to fix nitrogen make it an important plant in ecological restoration projects.
